overview: The purpose of this measure is to repeal the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo, and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). It will establish a new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). The measure has been amended by changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_).
appropriations: This measure will transfer all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo, and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). It will also appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_).
agency_impact: The University of Hawaiâ€˜i (UH) supports HB 1169 (HB1169_TESTIMONY_HED-EDN_02-05-25_). This bill would create one UH Conference Center Revolving Fund and each campus would have accounts within this overarching fund, which would allow all campuses to standardize conference center programs (HB1169_TESTIMONY_HED-EDN_02-05-25_). This structure is similar to many other UH funds, including the Tuition and Fees Special Fund, the Auxiliary Enterprises Special Fund, and the Student Activities Revolving Fund (HB1169_TESTIMONY_HED-EDN_02-05-25_).
economic_impact: Establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). This would thereby increase access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_).
policy_impact: This measure repeals the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo, and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). It has been amended by clarifying that all unencumbered funds in the existing funds shall lapse to the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund on the effective date of this measure (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). A significant amendment changes the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_).
revenue_sources: The new fund's initial revenues will come from the transfer of all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo, and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). The measure clarifies that all unencumbered funds in the two existing conference center revolving funds shall lapse to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund on the effective date of this measure (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_).
six_year_fiscal_implications: The measure has been amended by changing the effective date to July 1, 3000 (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). As a result, there are no fiscal implications for this measure within the next six years.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: Due to the amended effective date of July 1, 3000, there are no fiscal implications until that time (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The updated measure specifies the exact funds to be repealed: the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo, and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). It clarifies that all appropriations, encumbrances, and unencumbered funds from these repealed funds will be transferred to the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). A significant amendment has changed the bill's effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion, thus delaying any fiscal impact (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_). Testimony from the University of Hawai'i System indicates the new fund's structure will be similar to other existing UH funds and is expected to increase access to conference center usage on its campuses (HB1169_HD1_HSCR308_).
